entries.entry: Today my group presented the website we were working on. My group was awesome. I learned a lot about Git with this project.
Today we designed a basic site using Flexbox and modular design.
Today we learned the basics of how to automate site content generation with Javascript instead of hardcoding it in HTML. I am excited to learn more about this!

entries.concepts: Third Week Completed: JSON, Generating content from javascript, Postman
entries.entry: This week we learned a lot! I got the gist of everything at least. Brain hurt. Next week we start another group project. I'm excited to get to know some of my classmates more.

entries.concepts: Group Project 2, More JSON, Click events
entries.entry: This week we have another group project. My groupmates seem really smart. The project involves lots of fetching data from different databases with APIs. At the very least, I feel like I know more about it than last week. I also got a toggle button to work on the first try. That was a good feeling.

entries.concepts: Fetching, Posting, and Deleting from JSON with Event Listeners
entries.entry: Added post and delete functionality to my journal! Figured out how to position the delete button to the top right of its parent .div with CSS.
Got the journal entries displaying by date in descending order. After the entries get fetched, a .sort() is applied to the date objects in the array.
